intro: Eremosis littoralis, commonly known as the coastal eremosis, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a splash of color to the shoreline. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune habitats. Eremosis littoralis plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for small insects and birds.
